articles.author: Deutsche Welle (www.dw.com)
articles.content:
Health authorities in Denmark, Norway and Iceland on Thursday suspended the use of AstraZeneca's COVID-19 vaccine after reports of blood clots among some people who had received the inoculation.
The… [+13479 chars]
articles.description: Denmark, Iceland and Norway have stopped administering the shot while Italy has banned the use of a batch of AstraZeneca doses as a precaution after an unconfirmed number of people developed blood clots.
articles.title: COVID: Several European countries halt use of AstraZeneca vaccine - DW (English)

articles.content:
A batch of AstraZeneca vaccine under investigation by international health authorities for possible links to blood clots is not part of Alberta's supply.
Dr. Deena Hinshaw, Alberta's chief medical o… [+5884 chars]
articles.description: A batch of the AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine under investigation by international health authorities for possible links to the development of blood clots is not part of Alberta's supply.
articles.title: AstraZeneca vaccine, suspended by some European countries, not part of Alberta's supply - CBC.ca

articles.author: Antonia Mortensen, Schams Elwazer and Arnaud Siad, CNN
articles.content: (CNN)Denmark, Iceland and Norway have suspended the use of the Oxford-AstraZeneca Covid-19 vaccine while the European Union's medicines regulator investigates whether the shot could be linked to a nu… [+6971 chars]
articles.description: Denmark, Iceland and Norway have suspended the use of the Oxford-AstraZeneca Covid-19 vaccine while the European Union's medicines regulator investigates whether the shot could be linked to a number of reports of blood clots.
articles.title: More European nations pause AstraZeneca vaccine use as blood clot reports investigated - CNN

articles.author: AFP
articles.description: THE HAGUE: Europe’s medicines regulator said Thursday there appeared to be no higher risk of blood clots in those vaccinated against Covid-19, after Denmark, Norway and Iceland suspended use of the AstraZeneca jab.
articles.title: Blood-clot risk 'no higher' in vaccinated people: EMA - New Straits Times

articles.author: Jillian Deutsch
articles.content:
The European Medicines Agency said Thursday that Johnson & Johnsons single-shot coronavirus vaccine is safe and effective to use in everyone over the age of 18.
That paves the way for the Europe… [+1209 chars]
articles.description: The company will not start delivering doses to Europe until April.
articles.title: EU regulator recommends J&J coronavirus vaccine for use - POLITICO.eu

articles.content:
THE EUS MEDICINES regulator has granted authorisation for the use of the Johnson & Johnson one-dose Covid-19 vaccine in people aged 18 and over.

articles.description: Governments across the EU have been eagerly awaiting its approval as they struggle to roll-out vaccinations on a large scale.
articles.title: The single-dose Johnson & Johnson Covid-19 vaccine has been approved by the European Medicines Agency - TheJournal.ie

articles.author: George Lee
articles.content:
The European Union's drugs regulator has recommended conditionally approving Johnson & Johnson's single dose Covid-19 vaccine.

articles.description: The European Union's drugs regulator has recommended conditionally approving Johnson & Johnson's single dose Covid-19 vaccine.
articles.title: EMA expected to approve one-shot J&J vaccine - RTE.ie

articles.description: Antoine Griezmann admitted Barcelona were "gutted" after going out of the Champions League in the last 16 on Wednesday, as a 1-1 draw away to Paris Saint-Germain saw the Catalans lose 5-2 on aggregate.
articles.title: Barcelona 'gutted' at earliest European exit in 14 years - SuperSport
